alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Eastern Franklin; Essex; Lamoille; Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 18 at 3:08AM EST until January 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northeast and northwest Vermont and northern New York. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 7 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures cooling as the day progresses, with portions of the northern Adirondacks and Northeast Kingdom experiencing wind chills at 20 to 25 below zero after 5 PM. Winds are expected to become calm part of the night. Then around sunrise, south winds will return. While temperatures will be warming, there will be another window with twenty below zero wind chills.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Caledonia; Eastern Franklin; Essex; Lamoille; Orleans
